constitute.translation[0].definitions[0]: to be considered to be something
Failing to complete the work constitutes a breach of the employment contract.
The rise in crime constitutes a threat to society.
constitute.translation[0].definitions[1]: if several people or things constitute something, they are the parts that form it
We must redefine what constitutes a family.
In meanings 1 and 2, constitute is not used in the progressive You say
This is constituting a criminal offence
However, the participle form constituting is often used
Fish products are significant in Japanâ€™s imports, constituting 30% of the total
constitute.translation[0].definitions[2]: to officially form a group or organization
Constitute is usually passive in this meaning
